revised_title: Elastic Force of Dry Atmospheric Air and Freezing Point of Mercury
tldr: The author, Balfour Stewart, investigates the change in the elastic force of a constant volume of dry atmospheric air between 32°F and 212°F, as well as the temperature of the freezing point of mercury. He finds a slightly different coefficient of increase of elasticity of air compared to Regnault's findings and concludes that a properly graduated mercurial thermometer can accurately denote the true temperature even at the freezing point of mercury.
